snippet: Three recipes for broccoli from chefs who know what they’re talking about (they have children).
abstract: Three recipes for broccoli from chefs who know what they’re talking about (they have children).
lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, while researching Michael Moss’s cover story about broccoli’s image problem, I learned about the Kitchen Community, a Colorado-based nonprofit that has put up, in low-income neighborhoods, billboards with simple recipes to encourage people to cook. Cool idea, except that the broccoli recipe struck me as wrong: “Olive oil & salt, 350° oven, 1 hour.” Broccoli is a favorite in my house. During the week, I boil the florets in two inches of water, drain and add butter and salt. Sometimes, if I’ve had enough sleep, I go wild and sauté it after parboiling — this adds char and brings out sweetness. My husband can steam it with scientific precision. None of these methods take an hour; maybe 15 minutes.
